fields.description:
right now, you can click on the application in the title view to delete it, like you would a normal tag.

this should NOT be possible. firstly, we are not allowing delete atm. second, its entirely too easy to delete the application. one click and its gone, without a confirmation

fields.summary: Should not be able to delete applications from titles

fields.description:
as of the 13th, the 'public' api should not change.

the 'public' api is defined as the api as listed on the docs. other endpoints may change.

this ticket represents the final check that needs to be done to make sure:
- the docs are accurate for the endpoints in the docs
- only what we considered 'public' endpoints are in the docs
- there are no notes or extraneous info in the docs.

fields.summary: update transaction flow docs on platform_docs site

fields.description:
h3. Description

/v1/commerce/catalogs/:id/present returns a bundle's json if its part of the catalog, but it doesnt return the entity representation for the products within a bundle. this means that you can easily not know the names of the products in a bundle...there is no other way of getting that information from a client, other than using the present route.

h3. Tasks

* Implement [Dev]
* Update API documentation [Dev / Product]
* Update according sequence diags [Product]

fields.summary: transactions/:id/release api docs need to be added

fields.description:
- if inventory callback fails, both real adn virtual transactions should just be in verified state, and exist, and debit, but not have fulfilled yet. right now it will just break the endpoint
- so we should return 200, and the transaction, but the state should not be fulfilled
- add note to docs about watching state in response
- transactions: If inventory callback is a bogus url (ECONNREFUSED) it should do the same thing as if the url returns 500. right now a 500 is different than couldnt connect.

fields.summary: when inventory callback fails for item transaction, transaction creation and record_receipt fails

fields.description: is the product within the the callback the product thats being called back on? bundles should call back once per item, right? i think bundled item inventory callback has not been defined very well, need to know the proper behavior and test it.

fields.summary: ensure that proper product is within an inventory callback payload for a bundle transaction

fields.description: we need to hardcode an inventory callback url for them to make commerce transactions. Ask them what they want it to be. It needs to be always available and accept post requests with json bodies. there is no retry on failure atm.
